lead_paragraph: A celebration thrown by the ruler of Dubai for the Iraqi team after its Asian Cup victory was marred when Iraq’s Saddam Hussein-era national anthem was played, angering many players and prompting some to walk away. Confetti rained as the players arrived late Tuesday at the Dubai airport, where thousands of fans gathered to welcome the team and celebrate its victory. Emirates officials apologized for what was apparently a mistake, saying a technician responsible for the music was unaware there was a new anthem.
